business.headline: EU close to sealing historic India trade deal, says Ursula von der Leyen at WEFEuropean Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said negotiators had made substantial progress, but the deal still needed final work before both sides could seal it. "There is still work to do. But we are on the cusp of a historic trade agreement.

Trade disruption, energy realism and R&D push: Essar's Prashant Ruia at DavosAccording to Ruia, India's growth prospects remain strong, backed by its demographics, policy stability, entrepreneurial strength and prudent fiscal management.

From Tata to Infosys: Top Indian CEOs to meet Donald Trump at WEF DavosA delegation of prominent Indian corporate leaders is expected to attend the meeting, reflecting the country's strong representation at this year's World Economic Forum.

Sensex sinks over 1,000 points: 6 reasons behind today's stock market crashToday's stock market crash leaves the Sensex and Nifty at a knife's edge, and the next few sessions will decide whether this sell-off cools or spirals into something nastier.

Sensex ends 1,066 points lower, Nifty below 25,250; IT, auto stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,065.71 points to close at 82,180.47, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 353 points to end at 25,232.50. Both indices were down by over one percent at the closing bell.

Can India match China's manufacturing? Here's what it will takeSanjeev Krishan, chairperson of PwC in India, said India's industrial productivity is almost half of China's, and the gap exists not just in manufacturing but also in services.

PhonePe gets Sebi approval for IPO, targets $15 billion valuation: ReportThe Bengaluru-based company is now expected to move closer to the market with an IPO that could value it at around $15 billion.

Hybrid push, EV support, public transport: What auto sector wants from Budget 2026As Budget 2026 approaches, the auto sector is once again looking to the government for clear and practical policy support. Industry leaders say a stronger push for hybrids, electric vehicles and public transport could help balance sustainability with affordability.

Alchemy Capital launches Series 3 fund to tap India's next growth waveThe Series 3 fund will run for four years, with an option to extend by one more year. Investors will need to commit at least Rs 1 crore, which will be drawn in four parts of 25% each.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why the stock market fell todayAs of 3:30 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,065.71 points to 82,180.47. The NSE Nifty50 dropped 353 points to 25,232.50. Both indices were down by over one percent at the closing bell.

Retiring soon? Don't let these common tax blunders drain your savingsRetirement promises freedom and flexibility, but it also brings a quiet shift in how money is taxed. Small mistakes made during this transition can slowly drain your savings, often without you noticing until it is too late.

Gold, silver hit fresh highs: Will safe-haven demand keep driving gains?There is no stopping gold and silver. The two precious metals are on a roll, and experts say the rally may continue in the near term as global uncertainty keeps safe-haven demand elevated.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why it's stuck, how to check the status and whom to contactAn income tax refund delay can be frustrating, especially when everything seems in order. From data mismatches to bank account issues, even small errors can stop the refund from reaching your account on time.

Tariffs, tension and turbulence: Is it time to hit refresh on your stock investments?Global volatility may stay elevated, but investors can still stay on track by strengthening portfolios, adding quality stocks on dips, and avoiding emotional reactions. Resilience, not prediction, is the strategy that endures.

Why higher labour costs haven't hurt China's manufacturing leadManufacturing labour costs in China have risen sharply over the past three decades. By around 2022, Chinese factory wages were close to $8 per hour. In comparison, wages stood at about $2.3 per hour in Vietnam, $2.1 in Malaysia, $1.9 in Thailand and just $1.1 in India.

Sensex, Nifty open lower over weak global cues; IT and financials drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 269.93 points to 82,976.25, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 69.25 points to 25,516.25 as of 9:30 am.

Shadowfax IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPShadowfax Technologies IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,907.27 crores. The issue includes a fresh issue of 8.06 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,000.00 crores. It also has an offer for sale of 7.32 crore shares worth Rs 907.27 crores.

Not America, but Trump is definitely making gold great againUS President Donald Trump isn't making America great again, but he is unquestionably making gold greater than ever. As uncertainty deepens, the world's confidence is shifting from Washington to bullion.

India to be upper-middle income by 2030, third largest economy by 2028: SBIIndia is projected to become an upper-middle income country by 2030 and the third-largest economy by 2028. This economic transition reflects sustained growth and reform efforts but also poses challenges to maintain momentum.

India contributing to 20% of overall global growth: WEF chief Borge BrendeIn an exclusive interview with India Today, World Economic Forum President Borge Brende hailed India as the fastest growing of the large economies in the world, contributing to 20% of the overall global growth.

entertainment.headline: Actor Durga Krishna says her marital life changed after baby: I felt invisible Malayalam actor Durga Krishna spoke openly about her postpartum experience, describing feelings of isolation and challenges in her marriage after the birth of her first child.

Urvashi Dholakia on joining The 50: When I step in, the game changes Actor Urvashi Dholakia confirmed her participation in The 50, a new reality show featuring 50 celebrity contestants. The show's format is inspired by the French series Les Cinquante and promises unpredictable tasks and alliances.

Brooklyn Beckham says mother snubbed Nicola's bridal dress, denies stylist's claims Brooklyn Beckham publicly accused his mother Victoria Beckham of cancelling plans to design Nicola Peltz's wedding dress at the last minute, escalating a long-running family feud.

Sunny Deol's Border 2 runtime just minutes short of Dhurandhar: Report Border 2 is set for a release with a reported runtime of 3 hours and 19 minutes, making it only a few minutes shorter than Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar. The film's distributors are seeking extensive show allocations across cinemas nationwide.

Emraan completely different on and off-screen: Taskaree co-star Zoya Afroz Zoya Afroz, in an exclusive chat with India Today, shared how she had a very different image of Emraan Hashmi before working with him in Taskaree. She plays a pivotal role in Neeraj Pandey series, streaming now on Netflix.

No competing with Vijay, says Parasakthi's Sudha Kongara amid Jana Nayagan row Filmmaker Sudha Kongara discussed the challenges faced by her film Parasakthi in an exclusive interview. She commented on censorship, online harassment, and whether she sees Jana Nayagan's Vijay as her competition.

Kanye West to perform in India for the first time in April 2026: Report Kanye West is reportedly planning his debut concert in India in April 2026. His India tour will signal a notable moment for the country's live entertainment industry as it attracts more global acts.

Karan Johar backs Dhurandhar politics, says cinema should allow disagreement Karan Johar reflected on the politics of Dhurandhar, saying he was not offended by its ideology and admired its cinematic craft. The Ranveer Singh starrer had earlier sparked debate after Hrithik Roshan praised its storytelling but disagreed with its politics.

Suniel Shetty on Bharat Ke Super Founder vs Shark Tank: We don't abuse for views Suniel Shetty explains how Bharat Ke Super Founders differs from Shark Tank by focusing on values and mentorship. The show aims to create a supportive ecosystem where founders feel fearless and backed beyond just funding.

Memories of 2016: Anupam Kher's throwback post includes photo with Satish Kaushik Veteran actor Anupam Kher has posted a series of throwback photos from 2016. The highlight of his post includes a picture with his late friend Satish Kaushik alongside other Bollywood and Hollywood personalities.

Border 2 advance booking targets mega opening for Sunny Deol, eyes War 2, Gadar 2 Border 2 has begun advance bookings with promising sales. The film is set to premiere during the Republic Day 2026 weekend and is positioned for a strong box office opening.

Cast a Muslim star, but make him Hindu: Honey Trehan on film being shelved Filmmaker Honey Trehan has spoken about a film project that was abandoned after he was told the main character must be Hindu even if a Muslim superstar was cast.

Easy to trash someone: Suniel Shetty defends Varun Dhawan amid Border 2 backlash Suniel Shetty came out in support of Varun Dhawan after he faced trolling over the release of Border 2 song 'Ghar Kab Aaoge'.

Divya Agarwal likens The 50 to Squid Game: There are no shortcuts Divya Agarwal shared her thoughts as she joins the upcoming reality show The 50. She highlighted the unpredictability of the format and her preparation for the challenge in a recent interview. The show premieres on February 1.

Atlee, wife Priya announce second pregnancy: Our home is about to get even cozier Filmmaker Atlee and wife Priya Atlee announced that they are expecting their second child following the birth of their son Meer in January 2023.

Kunal Kapoor exposes western media bias, says narratives are manufactured globally Actor Kunal Kapoor reflected on media bias, questioning the idea that Western outlets are neutral or objective. He recalled a personal encounter that exposed how narratives are shaped by powerful interests worldwide.

O' Romeo trailer launch in Mumbai amid legal and security concerns. Check date Following speculation about security issues, the trailer launch of O' Romeo starring Shahid Kapoor will take place in January, in Mumbai, as the filmmakers address concerns raised by gangster Hussain Ustara's family regarding the portrayal of his life.

Ravi Kishan pushes for TV category at National Awards, plans to write to ministry Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has voiced his support for the inclusion of television in the National Awards. He also shared his intention to propose the idea formally to the ministry.

Dhurandhar on OTT: When and where to watch Ranveer Singh's biggest blockbuster Ranveer Singh's action film Dhurandhar will begin streaming on OTT soon. The makers have reportedly bagged one of the best streaming deals ever in the history of Hindi cinema.

general news.headline: Kasab didn't commit contempt: Supreme Court raps Maneka Gandhi in stray dogs caseExpressing displeasure over her recent podcast, the Supreme Court said Maneka Gandhi made 'all kinds of comments' and also flagged the BJP leader's 'body language'.

Noida builder arrested over death of techie who drowned in water-filled pitThe arrested builder Abhay Kumar is the owner of MZ Wishtown, a real estate project located in the Knowledge Park area. The arrest follows an investigation into the circumstances surrounding the engineer's death, whose car fell into water-filled pit in Greater Noida on Friday night.

Sensex sinks over 1,000 points: 6 reasons behind today's stock market crashToday's stock market crash leaves the Sensex and Nifty at a knife's edge, and the next few sessions will decide whether this sell-off cools or spirals into something nastier.

Nobody wants him: Trump vows 200% wine tariffs after Macron's Peace Board snubThe Board of Peace initiative was first announced by Trump in September 2025 as part of a strategy to resolve the conflict in Gaza. Since then, the administration has expanded the initiative's scope, inviting world leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, to join efforts to address a range of global conflicts.

India accelerates Samudrayaan: First dive set for May 2026The mission, spearheaded by the Ministry of Earth Sciences, positions India alongside elite nations like the US, Russia, China, France, and Japan in manned submersible technology.

Governor Ravi walks out of assembly, says national anthem insulted, Stalin reactsTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi walked out of the assembly session on Tuesday after alleging the national anthem was insulted, and refusing to deliver a state government-prepared speech that he claimed carried "inaccuracies".

Is karma returning to bite Denmark?Denmark is seeking military backing from European Nato allies as US President Donald Trump seeks to take over Greenland, a Danish territory. However, Denmark itself had reportedly refused to back Nato member Greece against Turkey in 1974, saying the military alliance has no role in a crisis between its member states, according to ex-Greek minister Yanis Varoufakis.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh won't bow down to pressure from BCCI or ICC, says sports advisorT20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have warned the ICC they will not accept pressure or "unreasonable conditions" over playing T20 World Cup matches in India, as the standoff with the BCCI intensifies.

China will replace Harvard's scientific crown, and India has no seat at the table yetHandcrafted ByOur Editors This isn't about rankings, but about who gets to write the rules of the future. While China is positioning itself to take Harvard's place in global science, India is left to choose between building its own research power, or staying a dependent player in someone else's Cold War.

Better burn the house now: France goes all out, openly mocks US over GreenlandFrance has now openly mocked its ally, the US, over Donald Trump's ambition to seize Greenland, under the control of Denmark, as tension between Washington and the European Union escalates.

NodeJS creator says era of humans writing code is over, suggests next options for software engineersThe state of Vibe Coding in early 2026 is such that even seasoned software developers are now saying that the days of manually writing code are over. The latest in line to say this is NodeJS creator Ryan Dahl.

Mum danced very inappropriately on me: Son Brooklyn's damning post on BeckhamsBrooklyn Beckham has issued a detailed statement claiming that his parents, David and Victoria Beckham, attempted to control his life and harmed his relationship with his wife, Nicola Peltz.

Naomi Osaka creates stir at Australian Open with unique outfit, video goes viralNaomi Osaka turned heads at the Australian Open as she arrived in a striking ocean-blue tie-dye outfit before her first-round clash against Antonia Ruzic.

India's trash sleeper cells now target Vande BharatWithin hours of its inauguration on Saturday, the Vande Bharat Sleeper express was strewn with plastic and spoons, as if civic sense had taken an early holiday. Though India is trying to upgrade to shiny Vande Bharat trains, old mail train habits seem difficult to shed for Indians. Here's why.

Virat and Rohit likely to be demoted, BCCI may scrap top contract bracketThe Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee has suggested removing the top bracket, the A-plus category, from the annual retainership contracts. As a result, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are likely to be demoted to the B category, having featured in only one format of international cricket since January 2025.

UP village to fighter cockpit: Aastha Poonia is Navy's first woman fighter pilotSub Lieutenant Aastha Poonia scripted history in 2025 by becoming the Indian Navy's first woman fighter pilot. Awarded the coveted Wings of Gold at INS Dega, her achievement marks a major step forward for gender inclusion in naval aviation and India's armed forces.

Why Uttarakhand's hills are without snow for the first time in 40 yearsThe lack of snow still raises alarms and renews the focus on the effects of climate change being felt across habitats and regions in India.

Yes, I killed my wife, but it wasn't murder: Indian-origin man to Australian courtAn Indian-origin man, Vikrant Thakur, has formally taken responsibility for his wife's killing but told the court that he is not guilty of her murder. The investigation into the case began in late December when Supriya Thakur was found unconscious at her home by police officers.

Why don't you have kids? This question needs to stopIn today's time, when being child-free is a common reality rather than an exception, questioning someone about why they don't have kids is intrusive, hypocritical, deeply triggering, and simply insensitive.

Nitin Nabin my boss, I am a worker: PM Modi welcomes new, 'millennial' BJP chiefPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday welcomed Nitin Nabin as the new and "millennial" president of the BJP during a grand ceremony at the party headquarters in Delhi.

Trump chickening out from military action in Greenland?Trump has become fixated on acquiring Greenland, the semi-autonomous territory of Nato ally Denmark. He has also dangled the military sword since the new year started. However, Trump seems to be now looking for an off-ramp from the standoff.

How Trump's H-1B fee could increase medical deserts in US, hit millionsThe crisis in the rural healthcare system in rural America might be worsened by US President Donald Trump's H-1B visa clampdown. The steep fee hike could cut off the supply of foreign-trained medical professionals to areas in the US that need them the most.

Live: Jana Nayagan release woes continue as court reserves orders in censor  rowJana Nayagan Hearing Live Updates: Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan was supposed to hit theatres on January 9, but was postponed after CBFC withheld the censor certificate. The Madras High Court heard both sides of the argument and reserved its order.

Satellites reveal pollution is worsening fog over North IndiaBy combining 15 years of satellite observations with advanced computer simulations, the team shows that high levels of atmospheric pollution directly lead to deeper, denser fog layers over northern India.

sports.headline: Naomi Osaka creates stir at Australian Open with unique outfit, video goes viral Naomi Osaka turned heads at the Australian Open as she arrived in a striking ocean-blue tie-dye outfit before her first-round clash against Antonia Ruzic.

Want Mitchell to replicate heroics in T20Is: Santner confident after ODI series win New Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner is confident middle-order batter Daryl Mitchell will replicate his ODI form in the five-match T20I series against India.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh won't bow down to pressure from BCCI or ICC, says sports advisor T20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have warned the ICC they will not accept pressure or "unreasonable conditions" over playing T20 World Cup matches in India, as the standoff with the BCCI intensifies.

G Kamilini ruled out due to injury, MI name Vaishnavi Sharma as replacement Mumbai Indians' wicketkeeper-batter Gunalan Kamilini is ruled out of WPL 2026 due to injury. Left-arm spinner Vaishnavi Sharma has been signed as her replacement for the rest of the season.

Gael Monfils bids emotional farewell to Australian Open after two decades Gael Monfils waved an emotional goodbye to the Australian Open after losing to Dane Sweeny in his final appearance at the tournament before retirement.

Indian-origin Nishesh Basavareddy, 20, wins maiden Grand Slam match Australian Open 2026: 20-year-old Indian-origin American, Nishesh Basavareddy, won his maiden Grand Slam main draw match, beating Australian Christopher O'Connell in a five-set marathon on Tuesday, January 20.

India series will offer perfect preparation for T20 World Cup: Lockie Ferguson New Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson reckons the five-match T20I series against India, beginning Wednesday, will serve as ideal preparation for next month's T20 World Cup.

Bangladesh cricket in freefall, turning into never-ending circus of chaos  Bangladesh cricket has spiralled into a self-made crisis, where chaos, controversy and administrative failure have consistently overshadowed the game itself, even on the eve of the T20 World Cup.

Clarke to stay with NZ squad for three T20Is as injury cover for Bracewell New Zealand pacer Kristian Clarke will remain with the squad as injury cover for Michael Bracewell during the five-match T20I series against India. Bracewell's participation, meanwhile, will depend on his recovery from a minor left-calf strain sustained during the third ODI in Indore.

Virat and Rohit likely to be demoted, BCCI may scrap top contract bracket The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee has suggested removing the top bracket, the A-plus category, from the annual retainership contracts. As a result, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are likely to be demoted to the B category, having featured in only one format of international cricket since January 2025.

Hardik Pandya surprises RCB's Gautami Nayak following her maiden WPL fifty Hardik Pandya surprised Gautami Naik with a congratulatory message after her maiden fifty in WPL 2026. Naik notched up a brilliant half-century against Gujarat Giants (GG), scoring 73 off 55 balls with the help of seven fours and six sixes in her innings.

Ricky Ponting's love for The Undertaker: How a WWE poster chokeslammed his bad luckRicky Ponting's passion for wrestling great, The Undertaker, sparked a unique superstition during his cricket career. This quirky ritual coincided with his prolific run-scoring, revealed his former teammate Jason Gillespie.

Quiet bat, loud rumours: Why Rohit Sharma can't afford another poor ODI seriesStar India batter Rohit Sharma finds himself at a crucial juncture in his career, following his poor show in the New Zealand series. As he turns 39 this year, the margin of error would be nil for the India star with Yashasvi Jaiswal eagerly waiting for his opportunity on the bench.

Has Alcaraz copied Djokovic's serve? Serbian great jokes about copyright claimAustralian Open 2026: Novak Djokovic joked about Carlos Alcaraz's serve motion being similar to his own. The Serb spoke about the similarities in their serves after his dominant first-round win at Melbourne Park.

Zadran, Rasooli star as Afghanistan stun West Indies ahead of T20 World CupAfghanistan gave West Indies a reality check with a 38-run win in the first T20I in Dubai ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. West Indies were restricted to 143/9 in their 20 overs, chasing a target of 182.

After India Open chaos, Sports Minister pushes SAI to save Olympic dreamsSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya held a meeting with the officials of the Sports Authority of India (SAI) to discuss the venue lapses during the India Open Badminton tournament.

Shreyas Iyer's T20 comeback: Can he force his way into World Cup team?India vs New Zealand: Shreyas Iyer's return comes at a crucial time, just weeks before the T20 World Cup 2026. With the tournament less than a month away, India appear to be lining up Iyer as injury cover for Tilak Varma while also offering the right-hander a timely opportunity to push his case for a World Cup berth.

Day 3 Live Score: Jannik Sinner in action, Gael Monfils ends Aus Open journeyAustralian Open 2026, Day 3 Live Score: Eighth seed Ben Shelton overcame a tricky test against Ugo Humbert in straight sets to progress to the second round. Madison Keys has stormed her way into Round 2, beating Oleksandra Olinykova at the Rod Laver Arena. Meanwhile, Gael Monfils, playing in the Australian Open for one last time, is taking on a local qualifier.

Saina Nehwal confirms retirement from badminton: Can't push it anymoreFormer world No.1 Saina Nehwal has confirmed her retirement from badminton, revealing her body can no longer handle the sport's physical demands after two years away from the court.

Kylian Mbappe urges Real Madrid fans to back Vinicius Jr. amid poor formKylian Mbappe has urged the Real Madrid fans to back Vinicius Jr. amidst the Brazilian's poor run of form in recent games. Mbappe said it wasn't good to blame just a player and the whole squad deserves to get stick with their performances.

RCB march into WPL 2026 playoffs with 5th straight win, thrash Gujarat in VadodaraRCB marched into the playoffs of the WPL 2026 season with a comprehensive 61-run win over a hapless Gujarat Giants side, who failed to deliver with the bat in Vadodara on Monday, Janaury 19.

India's top pole-vaulter thrown off train by TTE, viral video sparks controversyNational record holder Dev Meena and fellow athlete Kuldeep Yadav were told to deboard the train at Panvel station. Their mistake? Carry the essential gear of their sport – the pole, while returning from a competition.

Ashwin urges Jadeja to reinvent, find joy like Virat Kohli in twilight phaseFormer India cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin has urged Ravindra Jadeja to reinvent himself in the twilight phase of his career. Ashwin's advice comes after Jadeja struggled to have any impact in the ODI series against New Zealand.

AFCON: Morocco threaten to take legal action against Senegal after final fiascoMorocco Football Federation has threatened legal action against Senegal after Sunday's fiasco in the AFCON final. The game between the two teams saw incredible chaos as Senegal threatened to walk out of the game.

Manchester City sign Marc Guehi from Palace, defender explains reason for moveManchester City has completed the transfer of England international Marc Guehi from Crystal Palace, with the 25-year-old defender joining the Premier League champions on a long-term contract after extensive negotiations.

Gaurav Sawant Reports: ICC Issues Ultimatum to Bangladesh Over World Cup Participation in IndiaOn this Special Report, host Gaurav Sawant examines the escalating tension between the International Cricket Council (ICC) and the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB). The discussion centers on Bangladesh's hesitation to play World Cup matches in India, citing security concerns following the return of player Mustafizur Rahman. Gaurav Sawant notes, 'So the ICC has read the riot act to Bangladesh,' highlighting the ultimatum that the team must either participate or be replaced by Scotland. The panel, featuring sports editors Vikrant Gupta and Nikhil Naaz, explores whether these concerns are genuine or politically motivated by Bangladesh's interim government. Major Mohammad Ashraful Zaman defends the BCB's stance as a 'genuine concern' rather than politics, while other analysts suggest a potential 'logjam' that could split the cricketing world. The programme delves into the diplomatic friction and the potential long-term impact on bilateral cricket relations between India and Bangladesh.

Australian Open 2026, Day 3 order of play: Defending champions Sinner, Keys in actionDefending champions Jannik Sinner and Madison Keys will be in action as the Australian Open 2026 rolls on to Day 3 on Tuesday, January 20. Naomi Osaka and Ben Shelton will also start their campaigns in Melbourne.

Did Ajinkya Rahane blame Gautam Gambhir for ODI series loss to New Zealand?Former India captain Ajinkya Rahane questioned the Gautam Gambhir-led team management for making frequent changes after the home ODI series loss to New Zealand, stressing the need for clarity and a settled XI ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Arrested for GOAT tour mismanagement, organiser Satadru gets bail after 37 daysLionel Messi's GOAT tour organiser, Satadru Dutta, was granted bail after 37 days in custody. Dutta was jailed after chaos broke out at the Salt Lake Stadium during Messi's event.

Djokovic begins 25th Grand Slam quest with milestone 100th Australian Open victoryNovak Djokovic kick-started his quest for a record 25th Grand Slam title by registering his 100th career win at the Australian Open. The Serb defeated Spain's Pedro Martinez in straight sets in the opening round in Melbourne.

Steve Smith accepts T20 World Cup fate, targets LA Olympics 2028Australia's Steve Smith might have been snubbed from the T20 World Cup squad, but the 36-year-old is not ready to retire from the format yet. Smith has revealed that he wants to play in the LA Olympics, set to be played in 2028.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
